metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5128 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8 before 3.13.7.5, as used in Google Chrome before 23.0.1271.64, does not properly perform write operations, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> I had trouble tracking down an issue number or fix for libv8; with specific version number given in text, I've taken that to mean previous have a security flaw, without further information to confirm or deny mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
